main event: A glowing bell-shaped object was observed in Camden, New Jersey on 23 August 1957.
interesting points: The object was described as silver and glowing, approximately the size of a grapefruit., The observation lasted for about one minute., The witness, Mr. Halloran, did not observe any unusual weather or celestial activity during the sighting., The object was not detected by local radar installations., There is a suggestion that a weather balloon released earlier may have contributed to the sighting.
witness description: Mr. Halloran, a 45-year-old civilian carpenter with prior observer experience while in the Navy.
